results.title: This is my world
results.brief_description: Leanne is a virtual popstar. The artist dressed as the character Leanne (modeled on an anime character) sings a sorrowful pop song about her lonely world. The video is shot in the liminal no-place space of the Shopping Centre.

results.title: Psychological differences between the sexes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and the Family Living”.
Dramatises the way in which a young girl and boy react diversely to similar situations exemplifying some typical psychological differences between the sexes. Emphasizes the girls indirect, subjective approach as opposed to the boys direct objective approach. In marriage these differences can cause misunderstandings.

results.title: Engagement: romance and reality
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
Presents a young couple who plan to marry. They love each other but do not really know each other; their images are unrealistic. They discover the values they hold are different and realise they must begin to see themselves and each other realistically in terms of marriage.

results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.

results.title: This charming couple
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby, Affiliated Film Producers and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
The film focuses on the false ideals of romantic love on which too many marriages are built. It follows the courtship of two young people who refuse to evaluate each other’s qualities and shortcomings in a realistic adult way. They are unwilling or unable to alter their romanticised ideas of each other to agree with actual facts. Because they are in love with love and not each other their marriage is doomed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby, Affiliated Film Producers and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Handling marital conflicts
results.creator_credit: Paul Landis, McGraw-Hill Films and Centron
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
Through the development of an argument between each of two couples, elements of destructive and constructive marital conflicts are illustrated. The audience is encouraged to distinguish between the two, and in conclusion five comparative points are made.
